intro: Lecythis poiteaui, commonly known as the Brazilian walnut, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The tree produces an edible, oily fruit with a hard, woody shell enclosing a single seed. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in local medicine for their potential therapeutic properties. The plant plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
